configuration.application_title: COVID-19 Medical Resource Demand Dashboard - Virginia

scenarios.description: This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/6th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderate increase in transmission, and (d) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 8 days. Updated 2020-05-27.

This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/6th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderate increase in transmission, and (d) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 14 days. Updated 2020-05-27.

This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/6th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderate increase in transmission, (d) better detection has led to earlier quarantining (reducing spread), and (e) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 8 days. Updated 2020-05-27.

This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/6th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderate increase in transmission, (d) better detection has led to earlier quarantining (reducing spread), and (e) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 14 days. Updated 2020-05-27.

This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/3th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderately larger increase in transmission compared to LightRebound, and (d) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 8 days. Updated 2020-05-27.

This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/3th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderately larger increase in transmission compared to LightRebound, and (d) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 14 days. Updated 2020-05-27.

This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/3th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderately larger increase in transmission compared to LightRebound, (d) better detection has led to earlier quarantining (reducing spread), and (e) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 8 days. Updated 2020-05-27.

This model assumes (a) Virginia's social-distancing order is lifted on May 15th, (b) public social interactions return to 1/3th of pre-pandemic levels, (c) there is a moderately larger increase in transmission compared to LightRebound, (d) better detection has led to earlier quarantining (reducing spread), and (e) typical COVID-19 hospitalizations last about 14 days. Updated 2020-05-27.
